all.name: 20 Years of Paul Smith and Maharam
all.description: This book highlights our studios’ shared commitment to design and long-term exploration of traditional motifs reimagined through color, pattern, and scale. Three randomized cover variations.
all.contact: To order this item, contact Media at media@maharam.com

all.name: Bertjan Pot
all.description: Sales tool celebrating the work of Bertjan Pot which includes an interview between Marco Velardi and Bertjan Pot and with photography by Nick Ballón.
all.contact: To order this item, contact Media at media@maharam.com

all.name: Repeat by Hella Jongerius
all.description: A book documenting the process around Repeat by Hella Jongerius and Maharam's first textile collaboration with Hella Jongerius.
all.contact: To order this item, contact Media at media@maharam.com

all.description: A book celebrating Artek and Maharam's ongoing exploration of textile application on the Stool 60 by Alvar Aalto.
all.contact: To order this item, contact media at Media at media@maharam.com

all.name: Book Shipping Box
all.description: Shipping box for 60 60 and Bertjan Pot books.

all.name: The Archetypes
all.description: A set of twelve 15" x 22.75" newsprint posters, each features a single character named for Swiss psychoanalyst Carl Jung's twelve archetypes of personality and incorporates Maharam textiles.
all.contact: To order this item, contact Media at media@maharam.com

all.name: Sonnhild Kestler Poster Set
all.description: A series of poster sets including four original designs and an in-depth process booklet featuring photography by Nick Ballón. Three randomized cover variations.
all.contact: To order this item, contact Media at media@maharam.com

all.name: Maharam Agenda
all.description: Founded in 1902, Maharam evolved from a pushcart business on the Lower East Side into a leading global textile resource for architects and interior designers.Four randomized cover variations.
all.Note: This item is no longer available and will not be reordered.

all.name: Maharam Stories
all.description: Maharam Stories brings together a broad range of revealing and engaging design observations from luminaries such as Murray Moss, Hans Ulrich Obrist, John Pawson, Alice Rawsthorn, Michael Rock, Stefan Sagmeister, and more - packaged in a compelling design.
all.Note: This item is no longer available and will not be reordered.

all.name: Irving Harper Works in Paper
all.description: Known for his mid-century creation of the Marshmallow Sofa, Ball Clock, and Herman Miller logo as George Nelson Associates' director of design, Irving Harper made hundreds of rarely seen paper sculptures in his spare time from 1963-2000.

image: ./img/new/Books/Hella Jongerius I Don't Have a Favourite Color.png
all.name: Hella Jongerius: I Don’t Have a Favourite Colour
all.description: Hella Jongerius describes her method of research and application to Vitra products.

all.name: Reproducing Scholten & Baijings
all.description: The first monograph on Dutch design duo Stefan Scholten and Carole Baijings takes an in-depth look at their research-intensive, hands-on, and iterative approach to making as demonstrated across seven case studies including those with 1616/Arita Japan, MINI, Georg Jensen, and Maharam.

all.name: Alexander Girard
all.description: A monograph on seminal designer Alexander Girard and his distinctive career.

all.name: Claudy Jongstra
all.description: This volume explore's Claudy Jonstra's distinctive, sustainable approach and provides an overview on her career.

all.name: The Colors of Sies Marjan
all.description: A colorful, comprehensive volume documenting the short-lived but highly influencial work of Sander Lak's beloved and now cult fashion brand, Sies Marjan.

all.name: Karel Martens: Full Colour
all.description: An intimate and  in-depth photographic documentation of the prolific Dutch graphic design of Karel Martens.

all.name: Studio Job & the Groninger Museum
all.description: The book traces a survey at the Groninger Museum in the Netherlands featuring ten years of work by Job Smeets and Nynke Tynagel, including the Bavaria Marquette series and Ruins on the end pages.

all.name: Irma Boom: Colour Based on Nature
all.description: Colour Based on Nature takes the concept of Irma Boom's previous work further afield, highlighting UNESCO World Heritage sites across the globe and on every continent.

all.name: Jacob Hashimoto: Selected Kite Works & Installations
all.description: Colour Based on Nature takes the concept of Irma Booms previous work further afield, highlighting UNESCO World Heritage sites across the globe and on every continent.

all.name: Ilse Crawford: A Frame for Life
all.description: Ilse Crawford showcases her body of influential, holistic work,articulating her philosophies for design and living. Featuring StudioIlse’s work from private residences to hotels,restaurants, and retail this book illustrates the effectiveness of design grounded in human needs and desires.

all.name: Knoll Textiles: 1945-2010
all.description: A comprehensive study of Knoll’s innovative textile design and the company’s role within the history of interior design.

all.name: Textilepedia
all.description: An extensive textile dictionary that covers all essential fabric knowledge from different types of textile materials to finishing options.

image: ./img/new/The Autobiography of a Snake- Drawings by Andy Warhol.jpg
all.name: The Autobiography of a Snake: Drawings by Andy Warhol
all.description: The story of a snake trying to make it in the world of sixties high-society. Illustrations by Andy Warhol, afterword written by Arthur and Teddy Edelman.

image: ./img/new/A Coloring Book- Drawings by Andy Warhol.jpg
all.name: A Coloring Book: Drawings by Andy Warhol
all.description: An enchanting colorbook designed by Andy Warhol. Foreward written by Arthur and Teddy Edelman.

all.name: Hella Jongerius: It All Starts With a Yarn
all.description: This book celebrates Nick Cave’s collection with Knoll Textiles and shows insight into his creative process. Created by Bob Faust and Nick Cave. There are two versions of this book, one with a Big Floral Wrap cover and one without.

all.name: The Nick Cave Collection
all.description: This book celebrates Nick Cave’s collection with Knoll Textiles and shows insight into his creative process. Created by Bob Faust and Nick Cave. There are two versions of this book, one with a Big Floral Wrap cover and one without.

all.name: Blocks Tray Small by Scholten & Baijings
Blocks Tray Medium by Scholten & Baijings
Blocks Tray Large by Scholten & Baijings
Grid Plate Small by Scholten & Baijings
